item.title: Make Raspberry Pi boot from USB
item.description: Update EEPROM Start up the Raspberry Pi 4 with Raspberry Pi OS from SD card. To get latest EEPROM. In terminal, type: # Upgrade OS packages sudo apt-get upgrade -y # Get latest EEPROM sudo rpi-eeprom-update Output of above command: Note: make sure current and lastest are the same. Upgrade EEPROM: sudo rpi-eeprom-update -a After upgrading, reboot the Raspberry Pi 4, by typing:

item.title: Install Ubuntu to run Raspberry Pi
item.description: https://medium.com/@zsmahi/make-ubuntu-server-20-04-boot-from-an-ssd-on-raspberry-pi-4-33f15c66acd4 https://ubuntu.com/tutorials/how-to-install-ubuntu-on-your-raspberry-pi#1-overview Official Raspberry Pi 4 USB Boot is official! How-to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8tTFgrOCsig USB Boot Ubuntu Server 20.04 on Raspberry Pi 4 https://eugenegrechko.com/blog/USB-Boot-Ubuntu-Server-20.04-on-Raspberry-Pi-4

item.title: SSH to a Raspberry Pi Server
item.description: SSH to a Raspberry Pi Server Install SSH server and run it on Raspberry Pi Server (openssh server, port 22) SSH to a Raspberry Pi using ngrok . First, make sure to install ngrok on the device. Next, start a TCP tunnel on the device by listening on any port you choose: $ ngrok tcp 22 You started a session with SSH to Rasp.
